LJCTextBuilderLib.remarks: Use this code to include the Text Builder lib classes. <script src='../../../LJCJSCommon/LJCTextBuilderLib.js'></script>

members.LJCTextBuilder:
Represents a built string value. /// Constructor Methods /// Data Class Methods /// Add Text /// Append Text /// Get Text /// Other Get Text /// Attribs /// Append Element /// Get Element /// Other Methods The LJCTextBuilder class is designed for creating text. It can also be used to create HTML and XML text.

The LJCTextBuilder class stores the built text internally. The text is retrieved with the ToString() method.

"Append" Methods
"Append" methods add the potentially indented and wrapped text to the builder.
These methods append the supplied text without an ending newline. This behavior is done for consistency and it allows for appending to the existing text if desired.
The "Append" methods start the text with a newline if the builder already has text, param allowNewLine = true (default) and the builder text does not already end with a newline.

"Get" Methods
"Get" methods create and return the potentialy indented and wrapped text but do not add it to the builder.
This allows for using the text outside of the builder.
Use the "addIndent" parameter set to "false" when appending text to the builder that was retrieved using a "Get" method. This is because the indent may already have been added to the text by the "Get" method.

"Add Text" Methods
AddLine(), AddText()
These "Add Text" methods add text to the builder unmodified except for AddLine() which appends a newline.

"Append Text" Methods
Line(), Text()
The "Append Text" methods add the potentially indented and wrapped text to the builder. The Line() method appends a newline.

The AddIndent() method manually controls the current indent count. The indent string length is calculated with the properties (IndentCount * IndentCharCount) and can be retrieved with the IndentLength property.

"Get Text" Methods
GetLine(), GetText()
The "Get Text" methods create and return the potentialy indented and wrapped text but do not add it to the builder.
The GetLine() and GetText() methods modify the returned text the same as the Line() and Text() methods.

"Append Element" Methods
Begin(), Create(), End()
These methods append element tags and content. Begin() automatically increments the IndentCount by 1. Create() also increments the IndentCount by 1 if the isEmpty parameter is false and the close parameter is false. End() automatically decrements the IndentCount by 1 if the IndentCount is currently greater than zero.

"Get Element" Methods
GetBegin(), GetCreate(), GetEnd()
The "Get Element" methods create and return the potentialy indented and wrapped text but do not add it to the builder.

AddLine.summary: Appends a text line without modification.
AddLine.remarks: AddLine() is an "Append" method. It adds the unmodified text line to the builder.

AddText.remarks: AddText() is an "Append" method. It adds the unmodified text to the builder.

Line.summary: Appends a potentially indented text line to the builder.
Line.param: Indicates if the element can be indented.
Indicates if a new line can be added.
Line.returns: The potentially indented and wrapped new text value.
Line.remarks:
Line() is an "Append" method. It creates the text with GetText() and adds a new line after the text. The text is then added to the builder.
Line() works the same as Text() except it appends a new line.

Text.param: Indicates if the element can be indented.
Indicates if a new line can be added.
Text.returns: The potentially indented and wrapped new text value.
Text.remarks:
Text() is an "Append" method. It creates the text with GetText() and adds it to the builder.
Note: One should set the "addIndent" parameter to false when adding text to the builder after getting the text with a "GetText" method. This is because the the indent has already been added with the "GetText" method.

GetLine.param: Indicates if the element can be indented.
Indicates if a new line can be added.
GetLine.returns: The potentially indented and wrapped new text line.
GetLine.remarks:
GetLine() is a "Get Text" method. It creates and returns the potentially indented and wrapped text. It will start the returned text with a new line if the builder already has text.
It appends a new line to the returned text. The applied indent is the product of the class properties IndentCount and IndentCharCount. (IndentCount * IndentCharCount).
The "addIndent" parameter defaults to true. Set it to false to prevent indenting the line further.
The "allowNewLine" parameter defaults to true. Set it to false to prevent starting with a new line.
Wraps the text with a newline if the WrapEnabled parameter is true and the line length is greater than LineLimit.
GetLine() works the same as GetText() except it appends a new line.

GetText.summary: Gets the potentially indented and wrapped text.
GetText.param: Indicates if the element can be indented.
Indicates if a new line can be added.
GetText.returns: The potentially indented and wrapped new text value.
GetText.remarks:
GetText() is a "Get Text" method. It creates and returns the potentially indented and wrapped text. It will start the returned text with a new line if the builder already has text.
The applied indent is the product of the class properties IndentCount and IndentCharCount. (IndentCount * IndentCharCount).
The "addIndent" parameter defaults to true. Set it to false to prevent indenting the line further.
The "allowNewLine" parameter defaults to true. Set it to false to prevent starting with a new line.
Wraps the text with a newline if the WrapEnabled parameter is true and the line length is greater than LineLimit.

GetIndented.summary: Gets a new potentially indented line.
GetIndented.returns: The potentially indented new text value.

GetWrapped.summary: Appends added text and new wrapped line.
GetWrapped.remarks: Creates new wrapped line if combined line > LineLimit.

GetAttribs.remarks:
The returned text does not end with a new line. This allows for additions after the text.
Begin, Create and End text will start with a new line if the builder text already has a value.

Begin.param: Indicates if the element can be indented.
Indicates if the child elements should be indented.
Begin.remarks:
Begin() is an "Append Element" method. It creates the element opening tag with GetCreate() and adds it to the builder. The appended text does not end with a new line. This allows for additions after the text.
The added text will start with a new line if the builder text already has a value.

Create.param: Indicates if the element can be indented.
Indicates if the child elements should be indented.
Indicates if the element will be closed.
Create.remarks:
Create() is an "Append Element" method. It creates the element text with GetCreate() and adds it to the builder. The appended text does not end with a new line. This allows for additions after the text.
The added text will start with a new line if the builder text already has a value.

GetEnd.param: Indicates if the element can be indented.
GetEnd.remarks: GetEnd() is a "GetText" method which creates the element closing tag and returns the text value.

AddChildIndent.remarks:
Adds an indent for following child elements.
The indent will only be added if the createText length > 0 and the textState.ChildIndentCount > 0.

AddIndent.summary: Changes the IndentCount by the provided value.
AddIndent.param: The amount to increment or decrement the indent count.

EndsWithNewLine.summary: Indicates if the builder text ends with a newline.
EndsWithNewLine.returns: true if builder text ends with a newline; otherwise false.

HasText.summary: Indicates if the builder has text.
HasText.returns: true if builder has text; otherwise false.

StartWithNewLine.summary: Checks if the text can start with a newline.
StartWithNewLine.param: Indicates if a new line can be added.
StartWithNewLine.returns: true if allowed to start with a newline; otherwise false.
